android-cloexec-memfd-create.description:
Description

memfd_create()
should include
MFD_CLOEXEC
in its type argument to avoid
the file descriptor leakage. Without this flag, an opened sensitive file would
remain open across a fork+exec to a lower-privileged SELinux domain.

Examples:

memfd_create
(
name
,
MFD_ALLOW_SEALING
);
// becomes
memfd_create
(
name
,
MFD_ALLOW_SEALING
|
MFD_CLOEXEC
);
android-cloexec-memfd-create.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
